content.question: In Scenario <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, a block is placed at the bottom of a semicircular track, as shown. An identical block, released from rest at a height <math alttext="uppercase H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>H</mi></math> above the bottom of the track, slides down and collides elastically with the block at the bottom of the track. The block at the bottom then slides up the track and reaches a maximum height <math alttext="h sub max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math>. There is negligible friction between the blocks and the track. In Scenario <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the process is repeated except the blocks stick together when they collide. Which of the following correctly indicates the maximum height that the bottom block reaches in Scenario <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>?

choices.label: Greater than <math alttext="h sub max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math>
Equal to <math alttext="h sub max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math>
Equal to <math alttext="one half h sub max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math>
Less than <math alttext="one half h sub max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math>

content.answer: Less than <math alttext="one half h sub max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math>
